weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, the afternoon unfolds under a canvas of mostly sunny skies, although a gentle veil of clouds remains present, hinting at the capricious nature of the city's weather. Temperatures hover around a cool 59 degrees, gradually falling into the mid-50s as the day progresses, accompanied by a brisk west wind that whispers through the streets, its gusts adding an invigorating chill. The marine layer, although not oppressive, may still cloak areas of the city, particularly near the waterfront and the Golden Gate Bridge, causing a flicker of fog to dance across the skyline, softening the sharp contours of the structures below.

As the evening approaches, the sky will clear up, giving way to a tranquil night. Expect temperatures to dip to a refreshing 46 degrees, the evening air crisp and tinged with hints of ocean salt. Dressing in layers is prudent; a light sweater or jacket will serve you well against the cool breeze, while a breathable shirt beneath offers comfort throughout the day. Given the conditions, a leisurely stroll along the Embarcadero or a quiet visit to a local café would be perfect for those wishing to embrace the enchanting calm before the year draws to a close. The scene is one of understated beauty, inviting quiet reflection and simple pleasures, making for a delightful winter's day in the heart of this iconic city.
